content.heading: The Epworth Sleepiness Scale (A scale to measure daytime sleepiness)
content.dataTitle: How likely are you to doze off or fall asleep in the following situations? You should rate your chances of dozing off, not just feeling tired. Even if you have not done some of these things recently try to determine how they would have affected you. For each situation, decide whether or not you would have:

content.heading: Sitting and Reading
content.dataTitle: Sitting and Reading

content.heading: Watching TV
content.dataTitle: Watching TV

content.heading: Sitting inactive in public places(eg., a theatre or a meeting)
content.dataTitle: Sitting inactive in public places(eg., a theatre or a meeting)

content.heading: As a passenger in a car for an hour without a break
content.dataTitle: As a passenger in a car for an hour without a break

content.heading: Lying down to rest in the afternoon when circumstances permit
content.dataTitle: Lying down to rest in the afternoon when circumstances permit

content.heading: Sitting and talking to someone
content.dataTitle: Sitting and talking to someone

content.heading: Sitting quietly after lunch without alcohol
content.dataTitle: Sitting quietly after lunch without alcohol

content.heading: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI)
content.dataTitle: During the past month, what time have you usually gone to bed at night?

content.heading: During the past month, how long (in minutes) has it usually taken you to fall asleep each night?
content.dataTitle: During the past month, how long (in minutes) has it usually taken you to fall asleep each night?

content.heading: During the past month, what time have you usually gotten up in the morning?
content.dataTitle: During the past month, what time have you usually gotten up in the morning?

content.heading: During the past month, how many hours of actual sleep did you get at night? (This may be different than the number of hours you spent in bed.)
content.dataTitle: During the past month, how many hours of actual sleep did you get at night? (This may be different than the number of hours you spent in bed.)

content.heading: During the past month, how often have you had more trouble sleeping because you can't get to sleep within 30 minutes.
content.dataTitle: During the past month, how often have you had more trouble sleeping because you can't get to sleep within 30 minutes.
dataContent: Three or more times a week

content.heading: During the past month, how often have you had more trouble sleeping because you wake up in the middle of the night or early morning
content.dataTitle: During the past month, how often have you had more trouble sleeping because you wake up in the middle of the night or early morning
dataContent: Three or more times a week

content.heading: During the past month, how often have you had more trouble sleeping because you have to get up to use the bathroom
content.dataTitle: During the past month, how often have you had more trouble sleeping because you have to get up to use the bathroom
dataContent: Three or more times a week

content.heading: During the past month, how often have you had more trouble sleeping because you cannot breathe comfortably
content.dataTitle: During the past month, how often have you had more trouble sleeping because you cannot breathe comfortably
dataContent: Three or more times a week

content.heading: During the past month, how often have you had more trouble sleeping because you cough or snore loudly
content.dataTitle: During the past month, how often have you had more trouble sleeping because you cough or snore loudly
dataContent: Three or more times a week

content.heading: During the past month, how often have you had more trouble sleeping because you feel too cold
content.dataTitle: During the past month, how often have you had more trouble sleeping because you feel too cold
dataContent: Three or more times a week

content.heading: During the past month, how often have you had more trouble sleeping because you feel too hot
content.dataTitle: During the past month, how often have you had more trouble sleeping because you feel too hot
dataContent: Three or more times a week

content.heading: During the past month, how often have you had more trouble sleeping because you have bad dreams
content.dataTitle: During the past month, how often have you had more trouble sleeping because you have bad dreams
dataContent: Three or more times a week

content.heading: During the past month, how often have you had more trouble sleeping because you have pain
content.dataTitle: During the past month, how often have you had more trouble sleeping because you have pain
dataContent: Three or more times a week

content.dataTitle: In a day, how much time do you spend sitting?

content.heading: During the past month, how often have you taken medicine to help you sleep (prescribed or “over the counter”)?
content.dataTitle: During the past month, how often have you taken medicine to help you sleep (prescribed or “over the counter”)?
dataContent: Three or more times a week

content.heading: During the past month, how often have you had trouble staying awake while driving, eating meals, or engaging in social activity?
content.dataTitle: During the past month, how often have you had trouble staying awake while driving, eating meals, or engaging in social activity?
dataContent: Three or more times a week

content.heading: During the past month, how much of a problem has it been for you to keep up enough enthusiasm to get things done?
content.dataTitle: During the past month, how much of a problem has it been for you to keep up enough enthusiasm to get things done?

content.heading: During the past month, how would you rate your sleep quality overall?
content.dataTitle: During the past month, how would you rate your sleep quality overall?

content.heading: Do you have a bed partner or roommate?
content.dataTitle: Do you have a bed partner or roommate?
dataContent: Three or more times in a week

content.heading: If you have a roommate or bed partner, ask him/her how often in the past month you have had loud snoring
content.dataTitle: If you have a roommate or bed partner, ask him/her how often in the past month you have had loud snoring
dataContent: Three or more times a week

content.heading: If you have a roommate or bed partner, ask him/her how often in the past month you have had long pauses between breathes while asleep
content.dataTitle: If you have a roommate or bed partner, ask him/her how often in the past month you have had long pauses between breathes while asleep
dataContent: Three or more times a week

content.heading: If you have a roommate or bed partner, ask him/her how often in the past month you have had legs twitching or jerking while you sleep
content.dataTitle: If you have a roommate or bed partner, ask him/her how often in the past month you have had legs twitching or jerking while you sleep
dataContent: Three or more times a week

content.heading: In a day, how much time do you spend sitting?
content.dataTitle: In a car, while stopped for a few minutes in traffic

content.heading: If you have a roommate or bed partner, ask him/her how often in the past month you have had episodes of disorientation or confusion during sleep
content.dataTitle: If you have a roommate or bed partner, ask him/her how often in the past month you have had episodes of disorientation or confusion during sleep
dataContent: Three or more times a week

content.heading: Karolinska Sleepiness Scale: Subjective level of sleepiness at a particular time during the day
content.dataTitle: On this scale subjects indicate which level best reflects the psycho-physical state experienced in the last 10 min.
dataContent: Sleepy, but no effort to keep awake
Sleepy, but some effort to keep awake
Very sleepy, great effort to keep awake, fighting sleep

content.heading: Perceived Stress Scale
content.dataTitle: For each question choose from the following alternatives:

content.heading: In the last month, how often have you been upset because of something that  happened unexpectedly?
content.dataTitle: In the last month, how often have you been upset because of something that  happened unexpectedly?

content.heading: In the last month, how often have you felt that you were unable to control the important things in your life?
content.dataTitle: In the last month, how often have you felt that you were unable to control the important things in your life?

content.heading: In the last month, how often have you felt nervous and stressed?
content.dataTitle: In the last month, how often have you felt nervous and stressed?

content.heading: In the last month, how often have you felt confident about your ability to handle your personal problems?
content.dataTitle: In the last month, how often have you felt confident about your ability to handle your personal problems?

content.heading: In the last month, how often have you felt that things were going your way?
content.dataTitle: In the last month, how often have you felt that things were going your way?

content.heading: In the last month, how often have you found that you could not cope with all the things that you had to do?
content.dataTitle: In the last month, how often have you found that you could not cope with all the things that you had to do?

content.heading: In the last month, how often have you been able to control irritations in your life?
content.dataTitle: In the last month, how often have you been able to control irritations in your life?

content.heading: In the last month, how often have you felt that you were on top of things?
content.dataTitle: In the last month, how often have you felt that you were on top of things?

content.heading: In the last month, how often have you been angered because of things that happened that were outside of your control?
content.dataTitle: In the last month, how often have you been angered because of things that happened that were outside of your control?

content.heading: In the last month, how often have you felt difficulties were piling up so high that you could not overcome them?
content.dataTitle: In the last month, how often have you felt difficulties were piling up so high that you could not overcome them?

content.heading: A self-assessment scale to determine morningness-eveningness in humans
content.dataTitle: What time would you get up if you were entirely free to plan your day?

content.heading: What time would you go to bed if you were entirely free to plan your evening?
content.dataTitle: What time would you go to bed if you were entirely free to plan your evening?

content.heading: If there is a specific time at which you have to get up in the morning, to what extent do you depend on being woken up by an alarm clock?
content.dataTitle: If there is a specific time at which you have to get up in the morning, to what extent do you depend on being woken up by an alarm clock?

content.heading: How easy do you find it to get up in the morning (when you are not woken up unexpectedly)?
content.dataTitle: How easy do you find it to get up in the morning (when you are not woken up unexpectedly)?

content.heading: How alert do you feel during the first half hour after you wake up in the morning?
content.dataTitle: How alert do you feel during the first half hour after you wake up in the morning?

content.heading: How hungry do you feel during the first half-hour after you wake up in the morning?
content.dataTitle: How hungry do you feel during the first half-hour after you wake up in the morning?

content.heading: During the first half-hour after you wake up in the morning, how tired do you feel?
content.dataTitle: During the first half-hour after you wake up in the morning, how tired do you feel?

content.heading: If you have no commitments the next day, what time would you go to bed compared to your usual bedtime?
content.dataTitle: If you have no commitments the next day, what time would you go to bed compared to your usual bedtime?

content.heading: You have decided to engage in some physical exercise. A friend suggests that you do this for one hour twice a week and the best time for him is between 7:00 – 8:00 am. Bearing in mind nothing but your own internal “clock”, how do you think you would perform?
content.dataTitle: You have decided to engage in some physical exercise. A friend suggests that you do this for one hour twice a week and the best time for him is between 7:00 – 8:00 am. Bearing in mind nothing but your own internal “clock”, how do you think you would perform?

content.heading: At what time of day do you feel you become tired as a result of need for sleep?
content.dataTitle: At what time of day do you feel you become tired as a result of need for sleep?

content.heading: You want to be at your peak performance for a test that you know is going to be mentally exhausting and will last for two hours. You are entirely free to plan your day. Considering only your own internal “clock”, which ONE of the four testing times would you choose?
content.dataTitle: You want to be at your peak performance for a test that you know is going to be mentally exhausting and will last for two hours. You are entirely free to plan your day. Considering only your own internal “clock”, which ONE of the four testing times would you choose?

content.heading: If you got into bed at 11:00 PM, how tired would you be?
content.dataTitle: If you got into bed at 11:00 PM, how tired would you be?

content.heading: For some reason, you have gone to bed several hours later than usual, but there is no need to get up at any particular time the next morning. Which ONE of the following are you most likely to do?
content.dataTitle: For some reason, you have gone to bed several hours later than usual, but there is no need to get up at any particular time the next morning. Which ONE of the following are you most likely to do?
dataContent: Will wake up at usual time, but will NOT fall back asleep
Will wake up at usual time and will doze thereafter
Will wake up at usual time but will fall asleep again
Will NOT wake up until later than usual

content.heading: One night you have to remain awake between 4:00 – 6:00 AM in order to carry out a night watch. You have no commitments the next day. Which ONE of the alternatives will suit you best?
content.dataTitle: One night you have to remain awake between 4:00 – 6:00 AM in order to carry out a night watch. You have no commitments the next day. Which ONE of the alternatives will suit you best?
dataContent: Would NOT go to bed until watch was over
Would take a nap before and sleep after
Would take a good sleep before and nap after

content.heading: You have to do two hours of hard physical work. You are entirely free to plan your day and considering only your own internal “clock” Which one of the following times would you choose?
content.dataTitle: You have to do two hours of hard physical work. You are entirely free to plan your day and considering only your own internal “clock” Which one of the following times would you choose?

content.heading: You have decided to engage in hard physical exercise. A friend suggests that you do this for one hour twice a week and the best time for him is between 10:00 – 11:00 PM. Bearing in mind nothing else but your own internal “clock” how well do you think you would perform?
content.dataTitle: You have decided to engage in hard physical exercise. A friend suggests that you do this for one hour twice a week and the best time for him is between 10:00 – 11:00 PM. Bearing in mind nothing else but your own internal “clock” how well do you think you would perform?

content.heading: Suppose that you can choose your own work hours. Assume that you worked a FIVE-hour day (including breaks) and that your job was interesting and paid by results). Which FIVE CONSECUTIVE HOURS would you select?
content.dataTitle: Suppose that you can choose your own work hours. Assume that you worked a FIVE-hour day (including breaks) and that your job was interesting and paid by results). Which FIVE CONSECUTIVE HOURS would you select?
dataContent: 5 hours starting between 4:00 AM and 8:00 AM
5 hours starting between 8:00 AM and 9:00 AM
5 hours starting between 9:00 AM and 2:00 PM
5 hours starting between 2:00 PM and 5:00 PM
5 hours starting between 5:00 PM and 4:00 AM

content.heading: At what time of the day do you think that you reach your “feeling best” peak?
content.dataTitle: At what time of the day do you think that you reach your “feeling best” peak?

content.heading: One hears about “morning” and “evening” types of people. Which ONE of these types do you consider yourself to be?
content.dataTitle: One hears about “morning” and “evening” types of people. Which ONE of these types do you consider yourself to be?
dataContent: Rather more a “morning” than an “evening” type
Rather more an “evening” than a “morning” type
